thread.title: MH370: Wreckage found on Reunion Island by Johnny Begue
thread.title_full: MH370: Wreckage found on Reunion Island by Johnny Begue

author: Andrew Meldrum, AP
title: MH370: Wreckage found on Reunion Island by Johnny Begue
text:
JOHNNY Begue was out collecting stones on the French Indian Ocean island he calls home when he says he saw part of an aeroplane wing washed up in the sand.
The fragment may be the first clue to what happened to Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 , which disappeared last year with 293 people aboard.
Massive search efforts have failed to find any sign of the plane, and authorities are analysing the piece to see if it matches the missing plane.
“I knew immediately it was part of an aircraft, but I didn’t realise how important it was, that it could help to solve the mystery of what happened to the Malaysian jet,” Begue, 46, told The Associated Press.
“It is really weird, it gives me the shivers.”
Morbid discovery ... Remnants of a suitcase Begue found near the plane debris. Source: AFP
Begue is the supervisor of workers who maintain the paths to the beaches in the Saint-Andre area, keeping them from being overgrown by the lush tropical shrubs.
He said he called several of his workmates and they carried the wing fragment out of the water so that it would not be battered by the surf against the volcanic rocks that make up most of the beach.
Authorities wouldn’t comment Thursday on whether Begue was the first to report discovering the component. Colleague Teddy Riviere corroborated his account, and praised him for the discovery. Members of Begue’s soccer team kidded him on his new fame in local media.
Begue said he also discovered a piece of a suitcase nearby. But it’s unclear whether there is any link between that and the plane part.
FAMILIES REACT TO THE NEWS: ‘I selfishly hope this is not MH370’
Looking for more ... People comb the beach where the plane debris was found. Source: AP
Though authorities are still determining whether the plane piece came from Flight 370, Begue said last night: “We are going out in the morning to start making a memorial. We will use stones and maybe plant some flowers at the site.”
“We want to show respect for the people who died,” he said.
He said he called Radio Freedom, his favourite station in Reunion, and the police after he found the wing part. And within hours the world came to the realisation that the aircraft debris on the desolate beach on the island of Reunion was possibly from Flight 370.
“I was walking on the beach, looking for stones that are used to grind spices,” said Begue. “And there it was. It was very big, you couldn’t miss it.”
Begue is still getting used to the significance of the find.
“At first we didn’t know what it was. But now I understand. I am proud that Reunion is known for this big event.”
EXPERT OPINION: Could ocean currents unlock mystery? Incredible find ... French police carry the debris. Source: AP
Where Is Flight MH370? 52:07 Play video The disappearance of Flight MH370 stunned the world. In an era of smart-phones and sat-nav, how could a passenger jet vanish into thin air?
Oovvuu 11 Jun 2015 TV/Science TV/Technology TV/Current Affairs
